content: I am a Ph.D. student in Economics at the University of Tokyo, Japan. My research interests lie in political economics at the intersection of economic history and development economics, from applied microeconomic perspectives. I was born and raised in Nagano before moving to Osaka for my undergraduate study.
summary: I am a Ph.D. student in Economics at the University of Tokyo, Japan. My research interests lie in political economics at the intersection of economic history and development economics, from applied microeconomic perspectives.
title: Shuhei Kainuma
Transition to Broader-Based Politics: The Role of Suffrage Extension in Early 20th Century Japan
